Calculate Water Year from Date Vector

Source: R/calendar_helpers.R
get_water_year.Rd

Assigns a water year to each date in a vector based on a custom starting month. Common in hydrology, a water year groups months across calendar years (e.g., Oct-Sep).

Usage

get_water_year(date, water.year.first.month = 1)

Arguments

date

A vector of `Date` objects.

water.year.first.month

Integer (1-12) indicating the first month of the water year. For example, `10` for October or `6` for June.

Value

An integer vector of the same length as `date`, giving the water year of each date.

#' @examples # Water year starting in October (common in US hydrology) dates <- as.Date(c("2022-09-30", "2022-10-01", "2023-06-15")) get_water_year(dates, water.year.first.month = 10) # [1] 2022 2023 2023

# Water year starting in June (e.g., for monsoon-driven systems) dates <- as.Date(c("2023-05-31", "2023-06-01", "2023-12-01")) get_water_year(dates, water.year.first.month = 6) # [1] 2023 2024 2024

# Default: calendar year (Jan-Dec) dates <- as.Date(c("2024-01-01", "2024-12-31")) get_water_year(dates) # [1] 2024 2024#'
